post.description: Create an account for an individual or corporate.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code in which you want to create an account. e.g. `EUR`

friendlyName.description: User friendly name to easily identify an account. e.g. `Billing Account`

accountId.description: Only applicable to Multi Currency accounts. If the `id` of an existing Account is provided, the new Account will be created with same IBAN for the requested currency as that of the provided `accountId`.

domestic.description:
Applicable to `GBP` accounts on LHV Bank only.
`false` by default to create SWIFT capable `GBP` accounts. `true` for Domestic accounts for access to Faster Payments.

ibanCountry.description: Two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code e.g. GB

post.description: Create a new bank beneficiary under a parent beneficiary. The exact required fields can vary depending on the beneficiary's bank account country and currency and can be determined via the [Beneficiary Required Details](ref:get-beneficiary-required-details) API.

parameters.name: parentBeneficiaryId
parameters.description: `id` (UUID) from the create beneficiary request for the parent beneficiary under who the bank beneficiary will be created.

bankAccountCurrency.description: Three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code in which the beneficiary bank account is held.  e.g. `EUR`

paymentTypes.description: Types of payments that the beneficiary can receive. See [Supported Payment Types](doc:payment-types)

bankAccountCountry.description: Two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code where the beneficiary bank account is held. e.g. `GB`

bankAccountType.description: Type of the bank account. e.g. `Current`, `Savings`

bankName.description: Name of the bank where the account is held. e.g. `HSBC UK`

bankAddress.description: Address of the bank where the account is held.

bankAccountHolderName.description: Name appearing the beneficiary bank account.

accountNumber.description: Account number of the bank account.

bankRoutingCodes.description: Routing codes associated with the bank account.

bic.description: SWIFT BIC of the bank account.

friendlyName.description: User friendly name associated with the bank beneficiary. e.g. `My HSBC Account`

metadata.description:
Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to the Bank Beneficiary Object. Useful for storing additional, structured information on the Beneficairy. e.g your internal ID of your user etc.
e.g `"userId":"ABC1234, "userName":"Boris Johnson"

post.description: Create a new payout to an external bank account. A Beneficiary will need to be created before a payout can be made using this endpoint.

parameters.name: idempotency-key
parameters.description: Optional header for retrying requests without accidentally creating the same transaction twice.

accountId.description: `id` of the Account from where the payout will be made. e.g.`cWc4SktyWlkxM0hwcmdYe6FMdXRSQT09`

beneficiaryId.description: `id` (UUID) of the bank beneficiary to who the payout will be made.

paymentType.description:
Type of payment that the beneficiary will receive.
See [Supported Payment Types](doc:payment-types)

reference.description: Transaction reference to be sent to the beneficiary bank. The reference will appear on the beneficiary bank statement.

paymentDate.description:
Future date on which the payout should be executed.
YYYY-MM-DD e.g. `2022-04-29`

reasonCode.description: [Payout Reason Code](ref:reason-codes) if required for the selected `paymentType`

purposeCode.description: Applicable for SWIFT payments to the UAE only.  See Supported [Purpose Codes](https://apidocs.openpayd.com/docs/purpose-codes)

get.description: Get a list of all transactions filtered by various params.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Encrypted `id` (e.g.`cWc4SktyWlkxM0hwcmdYe6FMdXRSQT09`) or `internalAccountId` (e.g. `EUR12345678910112` of the account.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code of the transaction. e.g. `EUR`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
`createdDate` from which to list transactions.
Timestamp in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard. e.g. `2019-14-29T00:15:09Z` for April 29, 2019 0:15:09 UTC

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
`createdDate` until which to list transactions.
Timestamp in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard. e.g. `2019-14-29T00:15:09Z` for April 29, 2019 0:15:09 UTC

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Reference on the transaction.

parameters.name: sentFrom
parameters.description: Sender's name, account number, IBAN or Routing Code

parameters.name: sentTo
parameters.description: Beneficiary's name, account number, IBAN or Routing Code

parameters.name: shortId
parameters.description: `shortId` of the transaction. e.g. `20201106-BE8FIR`

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: UUID of the transaction.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: `INITIATED`, `PROCESSING`, `RELEASED`, `COMPLETED`, `FAILED`

parameters.name: excludedStatuses
parameters.description: Array of transaction statues to exclude from the query.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: `PAYIN`, `PAYOUT`, `ADJUSTMENT`, `TRANSFER`, `EXCHANGE`

parameters.name: updatedDateFrom
parameters.description:
`updatedDate` from which to list transactions.
Timestamp in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard. e.g. `2019-14-29T00:15:09Z` for April 29, 2019 0:15:09 UTC

parameters.name: updatedDateTo
parameters.description:
`updatedDate` until which to list transactions.
Timestamp in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard. e.g. `2019-14-29T00:15:09Z` for April 29, 2019 0:15:09 UTC

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to be returned. e.g. `page=0`

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size to be returned. e.g. `size=10`

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort by a parameter on the object. e.g. `status`

parameters.name: idempotency-key

identifier.description: Encrypted `id` of the source account. e.g. `cWc4SktyWlkxM0hwcmdYe6FMdXRSQT09`

destination.description: Destination account in the currency that you want to BUY.

identifier.description: Encrypted `id` of the destination account. e.g.`cWc4SktyWlkxM0hwcmdYe6FMdXRSQT09`

fixedSide.description: The side of the exchange currency pair that you wish to fix. You can fix the `SELL` or `BUY` side i.e. the source currency or destination account.

amount.description: Amount to be sold or bought.

The rate is quoted on the first currency as the base.

accountNumber.description: Account number of the bank account.

e.g `"userId": "ABC1234"`

post.description: Pix, an instant payment method popular in Brazil, operates by providing customers with a Pix string or QR code containing the payment amount for services or goods.
